intro: Forsskaolea viridis var. ehrenbergii, commonly known as the green leaf spurge, is a variant of the species Forsskaolea viridis, belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, green, and often fleshy leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Sudan and Eritrea. This variant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy plant in harsh environments.
